text: John Edward "Jack" Stoddard (September 26, 1926 - January 29, 2014) was a Canadian professional ice hockey right winger. He played 80 games in the National Hockey League (NHL) for the New York Rangers between 1946 and 1962. He was born in Stoney Creek, Ontario. Stoddard died on January 29, 2014 in Owen Sound, Ontario. He was 87 years old. He was outlived by his wife and children. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1926 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey right wingers Category:Disease-related deaths in Canada Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:New York Rangers players Category:Eastern Hockey League players
title: Jack Stoddard
